top_categories.workout_context: Rose City Rampage Gravel Race's Georgia plains gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Rose City Rampage Gravel Race's Georgia plains, Southern gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 55 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Rose City Rampage Gravel Race's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rose City Rampage Gravel Race. Train it until it feels boring.
55 miles on Georgia plains gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
At Rose City Rampage Gravel Race, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
When someone attacks on Georgia plains gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Rose City Rampage Gravel Race, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Base fitness for Rose City Rampage Gravel Race. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
2-minute all-out efforts on Georgia plains gravel. Closing gaps, responding to attacks, sprinting for position. Train the burn.
Smooth pedaling at 55 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Rose City Rampage Gravel Race’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Rose City Rampage Gravel Race requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on georgia plains gravel to build confidence. Expect: georgia plains, southern gravel, southeast us.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 55 miles of georgia plains gravel in Thomasville, GA.
